summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview conducted on September 3, 2019, with an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The inmate provides a detailed eyewitness account of the morning Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell, including observations of the guards' response and subsequent actions by MCC personnel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The document details the morning he was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: One of the interviewing investigators present during the inmate interview at the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: OIG SA
persons.role: Special Agent, Office of the Inspector General
persons.context: An investigator from the Office of the Inspector General present during the inmate interview.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: An Assistant United States Attorney present during the inmate interview.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: An MCC Lieutenant who responded to the incident in Epstein's cell and later helped coordinate covering cell windows.

connections.description: The Lieutenant was MCC staff who responded to the medical emergency in Epstein's cell and later supervised the covering of cell windows.
Both were investigators present during the joint interview of the inmate witness.
Both were present in an official capacity during the interview of the inmate witness.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. A guard discovered him, attempted resuscitation, and medical personnel responded. He was pronounced dead.

events.title: Inmate Witness Interview
events.description: An inmate witness was interviewed by the FBI, OIG, and an AUSA regarding his observations of the morning Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: The day before his death, Epstein left with his cellmate in the morning, was with his lawyers all day, and was brought back to the SHU via J Tier that night.

locations: Southern District of New York, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: An inmate witness provides a first-hand account of the morning Jeffrey Epstein was found dead, stating Epstein appeared dead when he fell with the guard who was trying to pick him up.

The witness states Epstein had no marks on his neck and he did not see a rope, contradicting an initial hanging narrative. The witness's cellmate also commented that Epstein lacked typical hanging injuries.
After the incident, MCC personnel, including a Lieutenant, covered the windows to cells on L Tier and used dividers to block views from the witness's cell and a camera.
The witness describes unusual activity the night before Epstein's death, including Epstein being taken to J Tier before returning to his cell and a lack of routine cell checks after midnight.
The witness saw a male come out of Epstein's cell with a sheet that had a loop and knot after the medical response had concluded.
